item.title: Hello
item.description:
I’m a product designer in Tokyo working on Indeed’s employer mobile application. I love diving into challenging projects with real social impact and good people. Having worked with teams in Seattle, Austin, New York, Nairobi, Ho Chi Minh City, and Tokyo, I seek a variety

item.title: Bosc MR
item.description:
For two years I worked with a variety of doctors in Seattle and Canada to design and build medical visualization software. At Pyrus we focused on VR software for perioperative education and AR-based navigation for percutaneous procedures.

Summary of achievements:

  • Created business plan and prototype to secure initial grant
  • Designed and built front-end of web application
  • Designed and built interface elements in Unity (Canvas)
  • Concepted & designed ‘Touch Motion’
  • Designed and built HoloLens web controller
  • Shadowed and interviewed doctors: synthesized needs and constraints
  • Ongoing usability testing

item.title: mSurvey
item.description:
mSurvey is a research technology company out of MIT that connects health researchers and businesses with populations in hard-to-reach areas using SMS. After spending a summer in Nairobi, I continued to provide design and front-end development support during my second year of grad school. The techincal expectations were much greater than anticipated, so I spent the first month focused on research and design, while spending evenings studying front-end languages, frameworks, and best practices. In the second half of my internship I was spending most of my time on interface development and battling d3.

Summary of achievements:

  • Created business plan and prototype to secure initial grant
  • Designed and built front-end of web application
  • Designed and built interface elements in Unity (Canvas)
  • Concepted & designed ‘Touch Motion’
  • Designed and built HoloLens web controller
  • Shadowed and interviewed doctors: synthesized needs and constraints
  • Ongoing usability testing
